image.altText: Lance Appleby is the victim of a suspected fatal shark attack.

props.synopsis: A week after the search for his body concluded, surfers and members of the local community have paid tribute to Lance Appleby who was taken by a shark while surfing on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Hundreds pay tribute to shark attack victim in touching paddle out event

image.altText: Jing Lee in November 2022

props.synopsis: Jing Lee is the latest in a string of senior SA Liberal party members to announce their resignation, relinquishing her roles as shadow minister for tourism and multicultural affairs.

title.children: Senior SA Liberal announces resignation from party

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: Two SA Police employees have been reported for unrelated corruption offences in just two days.

title.children: Two SAPOL employees facing unrelated corruption charges

image.altText: A fire truck stationed next to the Wangary bushfire as it burns

props.synopsis: On January 11, 2005 a deadly fire near the tiny hamlet of Wangary on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula rewrote the record books in terms of fire spread and intensity, and prompted the state's fire warning system to be written.

title.children: Twenty years on, the Wangary bushfire still impacts SA's emergency response

image.altText: Egg shelves 1 (1)

props.synopsis: Eggs are in short supply on some major supermarket shelves months after the avian influenza outbreak, and farmers say it could be some time before supply is back to normal.

title.children: No quick fix for egg producers struggling to fill shortage

image.altText: A composite black and white image depicting baby Kobi Shepherdson and glasses-wearing Henry Shepherdson

props.synopsis: Henry Shepherdson inflicted months of coercive control on the mother of Kobi Shepherdson before killing the nine-month-old in a murder-suicide that shocked Australia. The harrowing police statements of Kobi's mother reveal the extent of his manipulation.

title.children: 'Please don't do this': Mother's plea before baby killed in murder-suicide

image.altText: Zoe in her yellow Wiggle uniform (yellow skivy, a black skirt and tights) stands on an empty stage

props.synopsis: Like so many Australian children, Zoe Karatzovalis grew up watching The Wiggles. Now, she's gone from auditioning for The Wiggles with 160 other people to being introduced on stage as Zoe Wiggle.

title.children: Young dancer recounts 'surreal' moment performing with The Wiggles

image.altText: Researchers in protective suits conduct meth testing.

props.synopsis: Second-hand car buyers could potentially be at risk of third-hand exposure to methamphetamine, with new research examining the extent to which the drug spreads to surfaces such as dashboards in contaminated cars.

title.children: Meth research triggers warning to prospective second-hand car buyers

image.altText: The interior of Osler House in Wolston Park.

props.synopsis: In the late 80s, Debbie Manson was detained in Osler House, an adult ward for women judged criminally insane. For the first time, our camera crew has been given exclusive access to capture this fading nightmare.

title.children: 'Death will hunt you down': Inside Queensland's house of horrors

image.altText: A firefighter battles an inferno consuming a home, with a single hose.

props.synopsis: There is fire and fury on the streets of one of America's richest suburbs as its high-profile residents come to terms with the loss of their homes and the possible impact fire department funding cuts and cancelled insurance policies might have had on the disaster.

title.children: As Los Angeles burned, a millionaire called for private firefighters to save his property

image.altText: A Chinese man wearing a black muscle tee staring emotionless at the camera on a white door backdrop

props.synopsis: Since Myanmar's 2021 coup, criminal syndicate scam centres have thrived along the Thailand border, where hundreds of thousands of people have been forced into virtual slavery, with the latest among them appearing to be aspiring models and actors.

title.children: Fears male model who disappeared may have been trafficked to scam centre

image.altText: Three armed police officers in khaki uniforms walk down Bourbon Street

props.synopsis: Bodycam footage released by the New Orleans police department has revealed the end of the deadly attack carried out by a US Army veteran who killed 14 people on New Year's Day.

title.children: Video shows New Orleans attacker fired at police before they killed him

image.altText: Pope Francis is seen in white robes, ordaining a line of priests standing in front of him with heads bowed.

props.synopsis: While the requirement for celibacy remains for all priests, the newly approved guidelines encourage churches to view 'homosexual tendencies' as one part of the overall picture.

title.children: Vatican says gay men can train for priesthood, but can't 'flaunt' it

image.altText: A woman holding a mobile home standing among debris.

props.synopsis: Homes passed down through multiple generations have been lost in the Eaton fire — the second largest burning in LA — and it has left some Altadena residents asking why the city was not more prepared.

title.children: LA residents question lack of preparedness for 'apocalyptic' fires

image.altText: A young woman wearing a headscarf uses her smartphone

props.synopsis: Hardball tactics resulted in Apple pledging to invest $US1 billion in Indonesia, after the sales of iPhone 16 smartphones were banned for not having enough locally manufactured components.

title.children: 'Pent up' demand as Indonesia ban on iPhone 16 sales continues

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaking to the media at a lectern for a press conference.

props.synopsis: The start of Albanese's election campaign came as Justin Trudeau's prime ministership hit the fence and Elon Musk became the world's biggest political oxygen thief by buying into UK and German politics.

title.children: A week of signals for the wild way politics might unfold in 2025

image.altText: Close up side profile of a filly

props.synopsis: The Magic Millions Gold Coast Yearling Sale record has been broken twice in two days with a filly selling to a Japanese trainer for $3.2 million setting the newest record.

title.children: Racing delayed as Magic Millions yearling sale record smashed with $3.2m for filly

image.altText: Donald Trump appearing via videolink in a court room trial, next to his attorney.

props.synopsis: The president-elect appeared via video-link, complaining the court ordeal had been a "terrible experience", as he was sentenced over a scheme to hide hush money paid to porn actor Stormy Daniels.

title.children: Trump sentenced without punishment in Stormy Daniels hush money case

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A young white woman with long brown hair standing outside next to rubbish bins - one with a red and one with a yellow lid

props.synopsis: More and more people are turning to grassroots recycling initiatives to make up for wider system inadequacy. ABC NEWS spoke to two women who've set up schemes to help make it easier for others to recycle.

title.children: Red bin? Yellow bin? Do you know what to do with hard-to-recycle stuff?

image.altText: Older man in suit talking at an outdoor press conference in Werribee

props.synopsis: Long-time Werribee local Steve Murphy says it's an honour to be selected by the Liberal party as its candidate for a by-election next month.

title.children: Liberals unveil candidate for by-election in former Victorian treasurer's seat

image.altText: the back of a firefighter in a truck facing a huge blaze at Blanket Bay Road fire, Cape Otway

props.synopsis: The deadly winter fires in California are another warning for Australians to reassess climate risks, where we live and how we deal with emergencies in the future, disaster experts say.

title.children: 'We burn all year now': What Australia can learn from California fires

image.altText: Tennis player Emma Raducanu bends over to grab her ankle while practicing on court before the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Emma Raducanu says she is not taking treatment for an insect bite over fears of ingesting a contaminated substance.

title.children: Contamination concerns stop Emma Raducanu getting bug bites treated

image.altText: cctv image of two people dressed in black hoodies one on a bike outside a synagogue in newtown

props.synopsis: The president of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies says the targeting of synagogues with offensive graffiti should "sicken us all".

title.children: CCTV images released of suspects in Sydney synagogue swastika vandalism

image.altText: A soil sample containing lithium.

props.synopsis: The China Geological Survey says new discoveries mean the country's share of the world's known lithium reserves have increased from 6 per cent to 16.5 per cent.

title.children: China discovers massive new deposits of lithium

image.altText: Heather Knight and Alyssa Healy pose for a photo in their respective ODI kits and holding the trophy

props.synopsis: Alyssa Healy will be able to play as a wicketkeeper for Australia in the Ashes series opener after getting through a solid work out on her sore knee.

title.children: Australian captain Healy cleared to wicketkeep in Ashes opener

image.altText: young woman with long dark hair wearing a navy blue blazer stands with arms crossed in room with warm wall lighting

props.synopsis: High-profile Australians have backed a letter by young climate warrior Anjali Sharma calling on the government to protect the health and wellbeing of future generations.

title.children: Prominent Aussies demand climate laws to protect future generations

image.altText: rudy

props.synopsis: Rudy Giuliani has been held in contempt of court for the second time this week after violating a previous court agreement to stop making allegations of wrongdoing against two US election workers.

title.children: Giuliani held in contempt for repeating false claims about 2020 election workers

image.altText: A graphic showing a man's face in black and white against letters LGH.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police has determined there is insufficient evidence to proceed with criminal charges against the former boss of Tasmania's second largest public hospital over allegations of falsifying death certificates.

title.children: Police rule out investigating former hospital boss over falsified death certificates

image.altText: Launceston mayor Danny Gibson looks off to the side at a council meeting.

props.synopsis: Launceston City Council has asked former mayor Danny Gibson to repay almost $14,000 in legal and public relations fees incurred when his working with vulnerable people registration was under review.

title.children: Launceston council requests ex-mayor repay ratepayers for legal fees

image.altText: A detective stands over markers on a footpath.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old man dies after police say four carloads of men ambushed a gathering at a Wyndham Vale park on Friday night in a "ferocious" and "targeted" attack.

title.children: Young man dead after 'ferocious' park attack in Melbourne's south-west

image.altText: Dr Scott Lyons, Dr Chloe Watfern and Dr Thomas Longden

props.synopsis: Climate scientists are already recording a steady change in global temperatures, and experts warn cases of gastro, mosquito-borne illness and heat stroke are soon to follow.

title.children: Climate change is making us sick, from gastro outbreaks to eco-anxiety

image.altText: Two women stand waist deep in water at a beach.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has barely cracked 30 degrees Celsius but experts warn the state's suburbs lack resilience to warming temperatures and that puts people at risk.

title.children: Why a mild summer's day in NSW counts as a heatwave in Tasmania

image.altText: A man wearing a snorkel in the ocean, holding kelp

props.synopsis: Kelp forests decimated by sea urchins are being replanted in Port Phillip Bay in an attempt to rebuild the ecosystem.

title.children: Kelp is changing the seafloor in Melbourne from a desert to a forest
